An alabaster image of St  Michael weighing souls, while the Virgin Mary, protecting a soul beneath her cloak, lays her rosary on the scale to weight it in favour of a good soul, while to the right a devil tries to pull down the ugly and bad soul.
This alabaster was probably produced in Nottingham in the 15th century and is now in the chapel of Pembroke College Cambridge.
Praying for those in purgatory, and particularly praying the rosary and invoking the intercession of Mary was a popular devotion in 15th- century England.
